abstract: Ross Connelly, owner of The Hardwick Gazette newspaper, announces essay contest in which prize will be ownership of Vermont paper; Connelly says he no longer has energy required to continue to publish paper, which he has done for 30 years; fate of paper could point to future of other small-circulation newspapers across country.
lead_paragraph: The owner of The Hardwick Gazette started the contest after efforts to sell the weekly broadsheet drew a number of “tire kickers” but no firm offers, he said.

headline.main: Write an Essay, and You Can Own My Newspaper, Vermont Man Says
